pr_title: raids: add world region to scout overlay

timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.bodyText: This should be defined in an enum somewhere.
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.bodyText: What number is this default case? This seems very unsafe in the event new regions are added.
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.message:
raids: add world region to scout overlay

Adds the region of the world the scout was performed.

http-api: change World location to WorldRegion

Adds a new WorldRegion enum to replace the location id int to be able to save more information about each region.

+package net.runelite.http.api.worlds;
+
+import java.util.HashMap;
+import java.util.Map;
+import lombok.AllArgsConstructor;
+import lombok.Getter;
+
+/**
+ * Holds the data for each world's region (location)
+ */
+@AllArgsConstructor
+@Getter
+public enum WorldRegion
+{
+	// ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 and alpha-3 standard for country codes
+	UNITED_STATES_OF_AMERICA(0, "US", "USA"),
+	UNITED_KINGDOM(1, "GB", "GBR"),
+	AUSTRALIA(3, "AU", "AUS"),
+	GERMANY(7, "DE", "DEU");
+
+	private final int id;
+	private final String twoLetterCode;

timeline.bodyText: This change would duplicate the icon/image initialization per table row generated. Instead, cache the icons in a static block (like was done before) using a Map<WorldRegion, ImageIcon>.
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

+ * SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
+ */
+package net.runelite.http.api.worlds;
+
+import java.util.HashMap;
+import java.util.Map;
+import lombok.AllArgsConstructor;
+import lombok.Getter;
+
+/**
+ * Holds the data for each world's region (location)
+ */
+@AllArgsConstructor
+@Getter
+public enum WorldRegion
+{
+	// ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 and alpha-3 standard for country codes
+	UNITED_STATES_OF_AMERICA(0, "US", "USA"),
+	UNITED_KINGDOM(1, "GB", "GBR"),
+	AUSTRALIA(3, "AU", "AUS"),
+	GERMANY(7, "DE", "DEU");
+
+	private final int id;
+	private final String twoLetterCode;
+	private final String threeLetterCode;
+
+	private static final Map<Integer, WorldRegion> REGIONS = new HashMap<>();
+
+	static
+	{
+		for (final WorldRegion worldRegion : WorldRegion.values())
+		{
+			REGIONS.put(worldRegion.id, worldRegion);
+		}
+	}
+
+	/**
+	 * Gets the region using the location id
+	 * {@link WorldRegion} value.
+	 *
+	 * @param locationId the location id of world
+	 * @return WorldRegion the region of the world
+	 */
+	public static WorldRegion valueOf(int locationId)

replies.bodyText: @Nullable doesn't seem to be available in http-api as travis was throwing out errors that it couldn't find com.sun.istack.internal
replies.author: melkypie

timeline.bodyText: This type of thing becomes easy to miss later when adding a new world region. Keeping the previous code and changing getFlag to getFlag(WorldRegion region) can compile-time error due to the switch if you cover all possible enum values.
timeline.author: Adam-

replies.bodyText: Wouldn't it still throw an error since it couldn't find the file, if only an enum entry was added?
replies.author: melkypie

replies.bodyText: If it was run yes, but I don't think this is even tested so we wouldn't notice.
replies.author: Adam-

replies.bodyText: Added a test that would check for this
replies.author: melkypie
